verses.verse: He that dasheth in pieces<WH6327> is come up<WH5927> before<WH5921> thy face:<WH6440> keep<WH5341> the munition,<WH4694> watch<WH6822> the way,<WH1870> make thy loins strong,<WH2388> <WH4975> fortify<WH553> thy power<WH3581> mightily.<WH3966>

For <WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> hath turned away<WH7725> <WH853> the excellency<WH1347> of Jacob,<WH3290> as the excellency<WH1347> of Israel:<WH3478> for<WH3588> the emptiers<WH1238> have emptied<WH1238> them out, and marred<WH7843> their vine branches.<WH2156>

The shield<WH4043> of his mighty men<WH1368> is made red,<WH119> the valiant<WH2428> men<WH376> are in scarlet:<WH8529> the chariots<WH7393> shall be with flaming<WH784> torches<WH6393> in the day<WH3117> of his preparation,<WH3559> and the fir trees<WH1265> shall be terribly shaken.<WH7477>

The chariots<WH7393> shall rage<WH1984> in the streets,<WH2351> they shall jostle one against another<WH8264> in the broad ways:<WH7339> they shall seem<WH4758> like torches,<WH3940> they shall run<WH7323> like the lightnings.<WH1300>

He shall recount<WH2142> his worthies:<WH117> they shall stumble<WH3782> in their walk;<WH1979> they shall make haste<WH4116> to the wall<WH2346> thereof, and the defense<WH5526> shall be prepared.<WH3559>
The gates<WH8179> of the rivers<WH5104> shall be opened,<WH6605> and the palace<WH1964> shall be dissolved.<WH4127>

And Huzzab<WH5324> shall be led away captive,<WH1540> she shall be brought up,<WH5927> and her maids<WH519> shall lead<WH5090> her as with the voice<WH6963> of doves,<WH3123> taboring<WH8608> upon<WH5921> their breasts.<WH3824>

But Nineveh<WH5210> is of old<WH4480> <WH3117> like a pool<WH1295> of water:<WH4325> yet they<WH1992> shall flee away.<WH5127> Stand,<WH5975> stand,<WH5975> shall they cry; but none<WH369> shall look back.<WH6437>

Take ye the spoil<WH962> of silver,<WH3701> take the spoil<WH962> of gold:<WH2091> for there is none<WH369> end<WH7097> of the store<WH8498> and glory<WH3519> out of all<WH4480> <WH3605> the pleasant<WH2532> furniture.<WH3627>

She is empty,<WH950> and void,<WH4003> and waste:<WH1110> and the heart<WH3820> melteth,<WH4549> and the knees<WH1290> smite together,<WH6375> and much pain<WH2479> is in all<WH3605> loins,<WH4975> and the faces<WH6440> of them all<WH3605> gather<WH6908> blackness.<WH6289>

Where <WH346> is the dwelling<WH4583> of the lions,<WH738> and the feeding place<WH4829> of the young lions,<WH3715> where<WH834> <WH8033> the lion,<WH738> even the old lion,<WH3833> walked,<WH1980> and the lion's<WH738> whelp,<WH1482> and none<WH369> made them afraid?<WH2729>

The lion<WH738> did tear in pieces<WH2963> enough<WH1767> for his whelps,<WH1484> and strangled<WH2614> for his lionesses,<WH3833> and filled<WH4390> his holes<WH2356> with prey,<WH2964> and his dens<WH4585> with ravin.<WH2966>

Behold, <WH2009> I am against<WH413> thee, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> and I will burn<WH1197> her chariots<WH7393> in the smoke,<WH6227> and the sword<WH2719> shall devour<WH398> thy young lions:<WH3715> and I will cut off<WH3772> thy prey<WH2964> from the earth,<WH4480> <WH776> and the voice<WH6963> of thy messengers<WH4397> shall no<WH3808> more<WH5750> be heard.<WH8085>
